Token.Abstract: TMX Layer data. Can be either a tile or object layer. Depending on which it is not all properties are used, this is noted in the property descriptions.
The name of the layer. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: The name of the layer.

Token.Abstract: The name of the layer. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: The name of the layer.

Token.Abstract: The name of the layer. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: The name of the layer.

Token.Abstract: The layer's properties.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The layer's properties.

Token.Abstract: The layer's properties.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The layer's properties.

Token.Abstract: The layer's properties.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The layer's properties.

Token.Abstract: Reference to the tilemap to allow KTTileLayerViewController and KTObjectLayerViewController quick access to the KTTilemap object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tilemap the layer is part of.

Token.Abstract: Reference to the tilemap to allow KTTileLayerViewController and KTObjectLayerViewController quick access to the KTTilemap object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tilemap the layer is part of.

Token.Abstract: Reference to the tilemap to allow KTTileLayerViewController and KTObjectLayerViewController quick access to the KTTilemap object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tilemap the layer is part of.

Token.Abstract: Is set if this layer is an Object Layer. If NO it is a Tile Layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is an object layer.

Token.Abstract: Is set if this layer is an Object Layer. If NO it is a Tile Layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is an object layer.

Token.Abstract: Is set if this layer is an Object Layer. If NO it is a Tile Layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is an object layer.

Token.Abstract: Is set if this layer is a Tile Layer. If NO it is a Object Layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is a tile layer.

Token.Abstract: Is set if this layer is a Tile Layer. If NO it is a Object Layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is a tile layer.

Token.Abstract: Is set if this layer is a Tile Layer. If NO it is a Object Layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if this is a tile layer.

Token.Abstract: Whether the tiles on this layer are visible or not. If a tile layer is hidden, it will still create the tiles and therefore use the same memory as if the tiles were visible. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the layer is hidden (not visible).

Token.Abstract: Whether the tiles on this layer are visible or not. If a tile layer is hidden, it will still create the tiles and therefore use the same memory as if the tiles were visible. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the layer is hidden (not visible).

Token.Abstract: Whether the tiles on this layer are visible or not. If a tile layer is hidden, it will still create the tiles and therefore use the same memory as if the tiles were visible. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the layer is hidden (not visible).

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers Only) The layer's size (in tiles. The layer size is usually identical to the mapSize property of KTTilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the tile layer, in tiles.

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers Only) The layer's size (in tiles. The layer size is usually identical to the mapSize property of KTTilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the tile layer, in tiles.

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers Only) The layer's size (in tiles. The layer size is usually identical to the mapSize property of KTTilemap.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The size of the tile layer, in tiles.

Token.Abstract: How opaque the layer is. Value ranges from 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque). The alpha of a layer can be set in Tiled by moving the Opacity slider just above the Layers list. Default: 1.0. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: The alpha (opacity) of the layer.

Token.Abstract: How opaque the layer is. Value ranges from 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque). The alpha of a layer can be set in Tiled by moving the Opacity slider just above the Layers list. Default: 1.0. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: The alpha (opacity) of the layer.

Token.Abstract: How opaque the layer is. Value ranges from 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque). The alpha of a layer can be set in Tiled by moving the Opacity slider just above the Layers list. Default: 1.0. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: The alpha (opacity) of the layer.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly in all directions, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. If changed will set both endlessScrollingHorizontal and endlessScrollingVertical. Returns YES only if both endlessScrollingHorizontal and endlessScrollingVertical are YES. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats in all directions.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly in all directions, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. If changed will set both endlessScrollingHorizontal and endlessScrollingVertical. Returns YES only if both endlessScrollingHorizontal and endlessScrollingVertical are YES. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats in all directions.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly in all directions, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. If changed will set both endlessScrollingHorizontal and endlessScrollingVertical. Returns YES only if both endlessScrollingHorizontal and endlessScrollingVertical are YES. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats in all directions.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly along the X axis, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats along the horizontal axis.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly along the X axis, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats along the horizontal axis.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly along the X axis, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats along the horizontal axis.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly along the Y axis, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats along the vertical axis.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly along the Y axis, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats along the vertical axis.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer will scroll endlessly along the Y axis, repeating itself (wrap around) at map borders. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the map wraps around and repeats along the vertical axis.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer represents the "main" tile layer which is where (most of) the gameplay happens, it plays a special role in the tilemap renderer. Only one tile layer should have this flag set. If no tile layer has this flag set, the main tile layer is determined by having a parallax factor {1,1}. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the layer is set to be the main tile layer.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer represents the "main" tile layer which is where (most of) the gameplay happens, it plays a special role in the tilemap renderer. Only one tile layer should have this flag set. If no tile layer has this flag set, the main tile layer is determined by having a parallax factor {1,1}. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the layer is set to be the main tile layer.

Token.Abstract: If YES, this layer represents the "main" tile layer which is where (most of) the gameplay happens, it plays a special role in the tilemap renderer. Only one tile layer should have this flag set. If no tile layer has this flag set, the main tile layer is determined by having a parallax factor {1,1}. Default: NO. TILED-EDITABLE

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the layer is set to be the main tile layer.

Token.Abstract: Determines how fast this layer moves in both directions when scrolling the tilemap. Value between -1.0f and 1.0f, usually you only use the range from 0.0f to 1.0f. Negative values simply scroll in the other direction. Defaults to: (1.0f, 1.0f).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The layer's parallaxFactor.

Token.Abstract: Determines how fast this layer moves in both directions when scrolling the tilemap. Value between -1.0f and 1.0f, usually you only use the range from 0.0f to 1.0f. Negative values simply scroll in the other direction. Defaults to: (1.0f, 1.0f).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The layer's parallaxFactor.

Token.Abstract: Determines how fast this layer moves in both directions when scrolling the tilemap. Value between -1.0f and 1.0f, usually you only use the range from 0.0f to 1.0f. Negative values simply scroll in the other direction. Defaults to: (1.0f, 1.0f).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The layer's parallaxFactor.

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers Only) Reference to the KTTilemapLayerTiles object which contains the memory buffer for the tile GIDs of this tile layer. Always nil for object layers.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A tile layer's tiles.

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers Only) Reference to the KTTilemapLayerTiles object which contains the memory buffer for the tile GIDs of this tile layer. Always nil for object layers.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A tile layer's tiles.

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers Only) Reference to the KTTilemapLayerTiles object which contains the memory buffer for the tile GIDs of this tile layer. Always nil for object layers.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A tile layer's tiles.

Token.Abstract: Returns the tile GID at a specific tile coordinate, without the flip flags normally encoded in the GID. Returns 0 if there is no tile set at this coordinate (empty tile) or if the tile coordinate is outside the boundaries of the layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tile GID (without flags) at the given tile coordinate, or 0 for illegal coordinates.

Token.Abstract: Like tileAt but returns the GID including the KTTilemapTileFlags. To get just the GID from the returned value use tileAt or mask out the flip flags: gid = (gidWithFlags & KTTilemapTileFlipMask) - you don't normally need the flip flags unless they have some meaning in your game, for example if certain tile GIDs can only be operated from one side (ie a button tile that the player must approach from the correct side to operate it).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tile GID (with flags) at the given tile coordinate, or 0 for illegal coordinates.

Token.Abstract: Sets a tile gid at the given tile coordinate, leaves the tile's flags (flipping etc) untouched. A tile gid of 0 will "clear" the tile (empty tile).

Parameter.Name: gid
Parameter.Abstract: The tile GID to set. Must be a valid GID. GID flags will be ignored.

Parameter.Name: tileCoord
Parameter.Abstract: The tile coordinate of the tile to set the gid at.

Token.Abstract: Sets a tile gid at the given tile coordinate, including tile flags. Tile flags must already be OR'ed into the gid. A tile gid of 0 will "clear" the tile (empty tile).

Parameter.Name: gidWithFlags
Parameter.Abstract: The tile GID including flags to set. Must be a valid GID.

Parameter.Name: tileCoord
Parameter.Abstract: The tile coordinate of the tile to set the gid at.

Token.Abstract: Clears a tile at the given tile coordinate (sets gid to 0, clears all flags). Same as calling setTileGidWithFlags:0.

Parameter.Name: tileCoord
Parameter.Abstract: The tile coordinate of the tile to clear (remove).

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers only) Generates collision segments from the tile layer and a list of blocking GIDs. Generating the collisions is expensive and should be performed once during load.

Parameter.Name: blockingGids
Parameter.Abstract: A list of GID numbers which are considered blocking.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array containing KKPointArray, each defines a single contour's line segments.

Token.Abstract: (Tile Layers only) Generates collision segments from the tile layer, considering all non-empty tiles on this layer as blocking. Generating the collisions is expensive and should be performed once during load.

Parameter.Name: layer
Parameter.Abstract: The layer from which to derive the collisions.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array containing KKPointArray, each defines a single contour's line segments.

Token.Abstract: (Object Layers only) Creates and returns a CGPath for every polygon, polyline, rectangle and ellipse object on the layer.

(Object Layers Only) A list of "objects" on this layer. These "objects" are Tiled's rectangles, polylines and polygons. They can be used to position tilemap objects not editable in Tiled by (normally) using the first point of such an "object" as the origin for the actual game object. Always nil for tile layers.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of an object layer's KTTilemapObject objects.

Token.Abstract: (Object Layers Only) A list of "objects" on this layer. These "objects" are Tiled's rectangles, polylines and polygons. They can be used to position tilemap objects not editable in Tiled by (normally) using the first point of such an "object" as the origin for the actual game object. Always nil for tile layers.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of an object layer's KTTilemapObject objects.

Token.Abstract: (Object Layers Only) A list of "objects" on this layer. These "objects" are Tiled's rectangles, polylines and polygons. They can be used to position tilemap objects not editable in Tiled by (normally) using the first point of such an "object" as the origin for the actual game object. Always nil for tile layers.

ReturnValue.Abstract: An array of an object layer's KTTilemapObject objects.

Token.Abstract: Adds a tilemap object if the layer is an object layer. Ignored if the layer is a tile layer.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The tilemap object to add to the layer.

Token.Abstract: Removes a tilemap object if the layer is an object layer. Ignored if the layer is a tile layer, or layer does not contain object.

Parameter.Name: object
Parameter.Abstract: The tilemap object to remove from the layer.

Token.Abstract: The object at the given index.

Parameter.Name: index
Parameter.Abstract: The object at the given index.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The object at the given index. Returns nil if object does not exist or the index is out of bounds (contrary to NSArray which would raise an exception).

Token.Abstract: The name identifying an object.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the first object with the given name, or nil if there's no object with this name on this layer. Object names are case-sensitive!
